title: Calories in Stuffing
meta_description: Discover calories in stuffing per 100g serving, including carbs, protein, fat, sodium, and tips for variations to fit your diet.
assumptions: Prepared bread-based stuffing with butter, celery, onion, and herbs; homemade or from boxed mix, baked.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by recipe, brand, ingredients like added meat or nuts, and preparation method. Check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: 100g of prepared stuffing provides about 200 kcal, with high carbs from bread and fat from butter.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Low-fat version (use less butter or oil)

faqs.q: How many calories in a serving of stuffing?
faqs.a: A typical 100g serving has about 200 kcal; adjust for portion size.
Yes, around 600 mg per 100g due to seasonings and broth.

faqs.q: What are the carbs in stuffing?
faqs.a: About 25g carbs per 100g, mostly from bread, with 2g fiber.

faqs.q: How does turkey stuffing compare to other types?
faqs.a: Similar to bread stuffing at ~200 kcal/100g; cornbread versions may have more sugars.

faqs.q: Can I make stuffing lower calorie?
faqs.a: Yes, reduce butter or use vegetable broth to cut ~50 kcal per 100g.
